Position Summary The clinical specialist serves as the clinical expert for assigned Surgical Services.
The clinical specialist is responsible for the coordination of education for the practice of perioperative nursing.
This individual assesses and diagnoses specific learning needs of nurses in assigned areas, and then provides the appropriate clinical intervention for their development.
The clinical specialist serves as a clinical resource to the new nurse and their preceptor as well as the experienced nurse in the advanced practice setting.
Collaboratively working with the facility educators, the clinical specialist facilitates patient care and improves staff performance in the clinical specialty areas.
The clinical specialist ensures continuity between clinical practice and standards of care.
This individual works collaboratively with surgeons, staff, managers and other health care disciplines utilizing a team approach.

Job Title:  Clinical Review Nurse- Prior Authorization Duration:  03 months Contract Desired Start Date/End Date:  4/7/2025 - 7/7/2025 Location:  Remote - North Carolina Shift Type:  8a-5p EST   Job Duties: As a member of this team you will review medical records, collaborate with other disciplines within our plan, and rely primarily on state Medicaid policy to clinically review outpatient medical prior authorization requests from providers to better serve our members and their individual health needs.
We have a very tight knit team that has worked together for many years and is always welcoming and helpful in precepting and guiding any new hire we bring on.
We communicate daily, answering questions for each other and providing support where needed in our team groupchat.
We also have 3 senior nurses and 1 team lead ready and available to assist with day to day questions and process concerns as you learn your new role and systems.
Each nurse receives an assignment each morning, and the expectation for daily productivity is to complete >=16 authorizations, which is about 2 per hour.

Within this role you will gain experience reviewing NC state Medicaid policy, use of InterQual and TruCare systems, interdisciplinary work with discharge planners, case managers, and experienced medical directors.
You will review a variation of service types ranging from DME and Therapy to Outpatient Surgery and Home Health services, and many more.
This will aid in expanding your medical knowledge and improve overall understanding of the insurance side of healthcare that is often misunderstood.

Our team is knowledgeable, compassionate, driven and made up of some incredible nurses that have been doing this work for many years and provide priceless experience for anyone willing to learn and grow.
Skills Required: 1+ years of Utilization Management experience.
1+ years of Prior Authorization experience with TruCare MCG or Interqual.
3+ years of Nursing experience.
Education/Certification: Required: Certificate/Associates  Preferred: Bachelors Degree                             Show more                                                    Show less

Reporting to the Supervisor, Care Management, the Care Management (CM) Nurse will co-manage cases with the Care Management Community Coordinators (CMCC) and provide medical care management to San Francsico Health Plan (SFHP) members assigned to care management services.
You will be based within the SFHP office and will involve time in the community (e.g., at clinics and hospitals, with community-based organizations, and home visits etc.).
You will conduct medical assessments, chronic condition education aimed at self-management, medication reconciliation, and provide ongoing medical/nursing consultation to the CMCC.
SFHP proudly supports a hybrid work environment.
This role will be required to be in-office, on-site a minimum of 4 days per month.
This position is based in our San Francisco office, working in a hybrid setting of office, field, and remote.
Salary: $60 to $65 per hour What You Will Do   Coordinate care management/ coordination of care activities with the assigned CMCC and ensure all medical needs are addressed.
Provide nursing input on all co-managed cases with the CMCC; up to 50 cases at any given time.
Perform care management within the scope of licensure for members with complex and chronic care needs.

Provide consultation to CMCC on medical prioritization of a members care plan and outreach to medical care team members (such as PCP, Specialist, Hospitalist, and ancillary providers) Perform tasks electronically, telephonically or in person for case management or coordination of care: Conduct medical assessments to identify individual needs and inform creation of member-centered care plan in collaboration with Community Coordinator Coordinate with Utilization Management and Pharmacy teams on members medical and pharmacy needs.
Ensure member has access to services appropriate to their health needs.
Monitor and update the nursing care plan goals and interventions to match members motivation and priorities.

Provide targeted medical interventions focused on chronic condition, assessment and management, prioritization of medical needs health coaching education, and development of members self-management skills.
Coordinate care across settings and help client/caregivers understand health care options.
What You Will Bring Active California RN license without restriction and 3 years preferred experience in case management, discharge planning, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
BSN, MSN, or related degree may be considered in lieu of relevant work experience.
Experience with public health nursing or Care Management with safety net populations and those with complex psychosocial needs and multiple social barriers.

Knowledge of San Francisco County community resources, Medicare and Medi-Cal Medical knowledge of common medical conditions such as diabetes, hypertension, End-Stage Renal Disease, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, Asthma, Liver Disease, Hep C and chronic wounds.
Population-based perspective on care delivery and access disparities for vulnerable patient populations.
Working knowledge and use of Trauma Informed, Harm Reduction and Person Centered language and principles.
Experience educating members, their families and medical providers on post-discharge needs.
Bilingual in Cantonese, Mandarin or Spanish preferred.
Experience conducting home and other community-based visits.
Because this position requires member home visits, you must successfully complete a sex offender registry screen.
What We Offer   Health Benefits Medical: Youll have a choice of medical plans, including options from Kaiser and Blue Shield of California, heavily subsidized by SFHP.
Dental: Youll have a choice of a basic dental plan or an enhanced dental plan which includes orthodontic coverage.
Vision: Employee vision care coverage is available through Vision Service Plan (VSP).
Retirement  Employer-matched CalPERS Pension and 401(a) plans, 457 Plan.
Time off  23 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) and 13 paid holidays.
Professional development: Opportunities for tuition reimbursement, professional license/membership.
